dc_title_s: Wetlands: San Francisco Bay Area, California, 2003
dc_description_s:
This polygon shapefile depicts the extent, approximate location and type of wetlands habitats in the nine county San Francisco Bay Area Region, California. San Francisco Bay area National Wetlands Inventory (NWI) polygons were downloaded as individual shapefiles from the NWI website in summer 2007, then integrated into a ArcGIS 9.2 personal Access geodatabase by the San Francisco Estuary Invasive Spartina Project (ISP) to simplify visualization and interpretation of the data for the purposes of locating boundaries of tidal wetlands. Staff at ISP also used formulas to decode NWI wetland codes into added attribute fields to simplify interpretation. This dataset was developed/compiled for use in the San Francisco Bay Area Upland Habitat Goals Project, a Project used to identify a Conservation Lands Network (CLN) for biodiversity preservation to inform conservation investments and lasting cooperative conservation partnerships. The Conservation Lands Network GIS Database is the primary output of the Project. The data depicts the spatially explicit CLN that is recommended for the nine county San Francisco Bay Area Region, California. Bay Area Open Space Council, GreenInfo Network, Conservation Lands Network, and San Francisco Bay Area Upland Habitat Goals Project. (2011). Wetlands: San Francisco Bay Area, California, 2003. Bay Area Open Space Council. Available at http://purl.stanford.edu/fh513gb6510. http://www.fws.gov/nwi/ 

http://wetlandsfws.er.usgs.gov/NWI/index.html

Source metadata and data available at: http://www.fws.gov/wetlands/ This layer is presented in the WGS84 coordinate system for web display purposes. Downloadable data are provided in native coordinate system or projection.
dc_creator_sm: San Francisco Bay Area Upland Habitat Goals Project
San Francisco Estuary Invasive Spartina Project
